page.title: 18TILSTONE PADDOCKS.
page.content: {Tilstone Paddocks}were originally the stables and cottages belonging to {Tilstone House. Mr.R.E.Peacock}bought these and 7 acres of land in 1969 to train his race-horses. He trains for both flat and steeple-chase courses and has met with considerable success. To date he has had l75 winners. At the present moment he has twenty two horses in training and is helped by five full-time staff and two part- time workers. The horses are fed on crushed oats and race-horse nuts, with vitamins E and C added for strengthening muscle and heart.They eat about 15 lbs. of food per day and drink about 9 gallons of water. Mr. Peacock's horses race at most of the Courses around the country- Ascot, Edinburgh, Chester, etc.
